main event: On July 22, 1966, multiple witnesses observed oval patches of bluish-white lights moving rapidly in the sky over Kokomo, Indiana.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 50 minutes with a total of twelve witnesses present,There were conflicting accounts about cloud coverage during the sighting, with half stating it was clear and the other half indicating it was cloudy,The color of the lights was described as bluish-white resembling a mercury-vapor light,The lights appeared to emit a halo effect, with no beams of light seen reaching the ground,The investigation suggested that the lights could be explained as searchlights from Indianapolis, 40 miles away.
witness description: civilians including a Deputy Sheriff and various residents
